Portland.Green Memorial A.M.E. Zion Church: The Green Memorial A.M.E. Zion Church (also known formerly as the Abyssinian Congregational Church and Society) is a historic church at 46 Sheridan Street in Portland, Maine. Built in 1914, it is home to Maine's oldest African-American congregation; it is named for Moses Green, an escaped slave. The building was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1973.
